summary: This document is a forwarded email chain from March 2020, primarily containing a complaint from an individual to Australian integrity officials about alleged misconduct by Bond University Limited and Queensland government officials. The sender references the U.S. case against Jeffrey Epstein, suggesting the information may be relevant, but the core content details personal grievances involving stalking charges, intellectual property theft, and claims of a cover-up of sexual crimes at Bond University.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the defendant in the referenced U.S. case 'United States v. Jeffrey Epstein, 19 Cr. 490 (RMB)' to which the sender suggests their complaint may be relevant.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Addressed in the email as a recipient of the sender's 'Additional Submissions' which are suggested to help the Epstein case.

persons.name: Nikola Stepanov
persons.context: Primary addressee of the complaint letter, to whom concerns about the Attorney General of Queensland and Bond University are directed.

persons.name: Ronald Sackville
persons.role: Commissioner, Royal Commission into Violence, Abuse, Neglect and Exploitation of People with Disability
persons.context: Addressee of submissions filed by the sender regarding alleged misconduct by Bond University Limited.

persons.name: Yvette D'ath
persons.role: Attorney General of Queensland and Minister of Justice
persons.context: Subject of the sender's 'extremely serious concerns' regarding her actions, alleged commercial deals with Bond University, and potential abuse of power.

persons.name: Karen Andrews
persons.role: Federal Member for McPherson, Minister for Industry, Science & Technology
persons.context: Referenced in an email from her Electorate Officer, Emily Neal, acknowledging the sender's communication.

persons.name: Emily Neal
persons.role: Electorate Officer for Karen Andrews MP
persons.context: Authored a brief email acknowledging the sender's communication on behalf of Karen Andrews.

persons.name: Prince Andrew The Duke of York
persons.context: Referenced as the figure behind the 'Pitch@Palace' competition from which the sender claims Bond University had them removed. His executive assistance allegedly confirmed this.

persons.name: Shiva Amiri
persons.context: Identified as the sender's former girlfriend who was allegedly sexually harassed/raped by male staff at Bond University. She is also the subject of the sender's past stalking charge.

persons.name: Michael Dean
persons.role: In-House Counsel and Company Secretary, Bond University Limited
persons.context: Named as a recipient of the sender's demand for financial refunds and compensation from Bond University. Described as having lied and failed to help.

persons.name: Annabelle Bennett
persons.context: Named alongside Michael Dean as a recipient of the sender's demand for financial refunds and compensation from Bond University.

connections.description: The sender alleges the Attorney General has a history of making commercial deals with Bond University, including a new program for sexting offenders.
The sender is a former alumni who claims the university stole his commercial ideas, had him removed from competitions, and orchestrated actions against him.

connections.person2: Prince Andrew The Duke of York
connections.description: The sender claims Bond University had him removed from the 'Pitch@Palace' competition run by Prince Andrew and his team in 2017 and 2018.
The sender alleges his then-girlfriend, Shiva Amiri (a Bond student), was sexually harassed/raped by male staff at Bond University and no action was taken.

events.title: Sender's Stalking Charge and Legal Issues
events.description: The sender references a past charge of stalking against his girlfriend, Shiva Amiri, and ongoing legal matters including a QCAT hearing in early 2020.

events.title: Removal from Pitch@Palace Competition
events.description: The sender claims he was removed from the Pitch@Palace competition (associated with Prince Andrew) on multiple occasions, allegedly orchestrated by Bond University.
personsInvolved: Prince Andrew The Duke of York

events.title: Email Forwarded to U.S. Attorney's Office
events.description: An email chain containing complaints about Australian entities is forwarded to Geoffrey S. Berman, the U.S. Attorney for the SDNY, with a note suggesting it may help the Jeffrey Epstein case.

keyFacts: The document is an email forwarded to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, suggesting its content may be relevant to the case 'United States v. Jeffrey Epstein'.

The core complaint alleges widespread corruption, cover-ups of sexual crimes, intellectual property theft, and orchestrated legal harassment by Bond University Limited and Queensland government officials, particularly Attorney General Yvette D'ath.
The sender claims Bond University had him removed from Prince Andrew's 'Pitch@Palace' competition and that the university has a history of staff who are 'serial predators and paedophiles'.

The sender references open investigations with the Office of the Australian Information Commissioner (OAIC) and the Queensland Office of the Information Commissioner (OIC) regarding misuse of his personal information.
The document links personal grievances in Australia to the international Jeffrey Epstein case, though the direct evidentiary connection is not specified in the provided text.
